intro: Calycolpus glaber, commonly known as the smooth calycolpus, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are smooth and glossy. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
